00024 static std::ostream& operator<< (std::ostream& out, cMessage *msg)
00025 {
00026     out << "(" << msg->getClassName() << ")" << msg->getFullName();
00027     return out;

00029 
00030 static std::ostream& operator<< (std::ostream& out, const ARP::ARPCacheEntry& e)
00031 {
00032     if (e.pending)
00033         out << "pending (" << e.numRetries << " retries)";
00034     else
00035         out << "MAC:" << e.macAddress << "  age:" << floor(simTime()-e.lastUpdate) << "s";
00036     return out;
00037 }

00040 Define_Module (ARP);
00041 
00042 void ARP::initialize()
00043 {
00044     ift = InterfaceTableAccess().get();
00045     rt = RoutingTableAccess().get();
00046 
00047     nicOutBaseGateId = gateSize("nicOut")==0 ? -1 : gate("nicOut",0)->getId();
00048 
00049     retryTimeout = par("retryTimeout");
00050     retryCount = par("retryCount");
00051     cacheTimeout = par("cacheTimeout");
00052     doProxyARP = par("proxyARP");
00053 
00054     pendingQueue.setName("pendingQueue");
00055 
00056     // init statistics
00057     numRequestsSent = numRepliesSent = 0;
00058     numResolutions = numFailedResolutions = 0;
00059     WATCH(numRequestsSent);
00060     WATCH(numRepliesSent);
00061     WATCH(numResolutions);
00062     WATCH(numFailedResolutions);
00063 
00064     WATCH_PTRMAP(arpCache);
00065 }
00066 
00067 void ARP::finish()
00068 {
00069     recordScalar("ARP requests sent", numRequestsSent);
00070     recordScalar("ARP replies sent", numRepliesSent);
00071     recordScalar("ARP resolutions", numResolutions);
00072     recordScalar("failed ARP resolutions", numFailedResolutions);
00073 }
00074 
00075 ARP::~ARP()
00076 {
00077     while (!arpCache.empty())
00078     {
00079         ARPCache::iterator i = arpCache.begin();
00080         delete (*i).second;
00081         arpCache.erase(i);
00082     }
00083 }
00084 
00085 void ARP::handleMessage(cMessage *msg)
00086 {
00087     if (msg->isSelfMessage())
00088     {
00089         requestTimedOut(msg);
00090     }
00091     else if (dynamic_cast<ARPPacket *>(msg))
00092     {
00093         ARPPacket *arp = (ARPPacket *)msg;
00094         processARPPacket(arp);
00095     }
00096     else // not ARP
00097     {
00098         processOutboundPacket(msg);
00099     }
00100     if (ev.isGUI())
00101         updateDisplayString();
00102 }
00103 
00104 void ARP::updateDisplayString()
00105 {
00106     char buf[80];
00107     sprintf(buf, "%d cache entries\nsent req:%ld repl:%ld fail:%ld",
00108                  arpCache.size(), numRequestsSent, numRepliesSent, numFailedResolutions);
00109     getDisplayString().setTagArg("t",0,buf);
00110 }
00111 
00112 void ARP::processOutboundPacket(cMessage *msg)
00113 {
00114     EV << "Packet " << msg << " arrived from higher layer, ";
00115 
00116     // get next hop address from control info in packet
00117     IPRoutingDecision *controlInfo = check_and_cast<IPRoutingDecision*>(msg->removeControlInfo());
00118     IPAddress nextHopAddr = controlInfo->getNextHopAddr();
00119     InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterfaceById(controlInfo->getInterfaceId());
00120     delete controlInfo;
00121 
00122     // if output interface is not broadcast, don't bother with ARP
00123     if (!ie->isBroadcast())
00124     {
00125         EV << "output interface " << ie->getName() << " is not broadcast, skipping ARP\n";
00126         send(msg, nicOutBaseGateId + ie->getNetworkLayerGateIndex());
00127         return;
00128     }
00129 
00130     // determine what address to look up in ARP cache
00131     if (!nextHopAddr.isUnspecified())
00132     {
00133         EV << "using next-hop address " << nextHopAddr << "\n";
00134     }
00135     else
00136     {
00137         // try proxy ARP
00138         IPDatagram *datagram = check_and_cast<IPDatagram *>(msg);
00139         nextHopAddr = datagram->getDestAddress();
00140         EV << "no next-hop address, using destination address " << nextHopAddr << " (proxy ARP)\n";
00141     }
00142 
00143     //
00144     // Handle multicast IP addresses. RFC 1112, section 6.4 says:
00145     // "An IP host group address is mapped to an Ethernet multicast address
00146     // by placing the low-order 23 bits of the IP address into the low-order
00147     // 23 bits of the Ethernet multicast address 01-00-5E-00-00-00 (hex).
00148     // Because there are 28 significant bits in an IP host group address,
00149     // more than one host group address may map to the same Ethernet multicast
00150     // address."
00151     //
00152     if (nextHopAddr.isMulticast())
00153     {
00154         // FIXME: we do a simpler solution right now: send to the Broadcast MAC address
00155         EV << "destination address is multicast, sending packet to broadcast MAC address\n";
00156         static MACAddress broadcastAddr("FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF");
00157         sendPacketToNIC(msg, ie, broadcastAddr);
00158         return;
00159 #if 0
00160         // experimental RFC 1112 code
00161         // TBD needs counterpart to be implemented in EtherMAC processReceivedDataFrame().
00162         unsigned char macBytes[6];
00163         macBytes[0] = 0x01;
00164         macBytes[1] = 0x00;
00165         macBytes[2] = 0x5e;
00166         macBytes[3] = nextHopAddr.getDByte(1) & 0x7f;
00167         macBytes[4] = nextHopAddr.getDByte(2);
00168         macBytes[5] = nextHopAddr.getDByte(3);
00169         MACAddress multicastMacAddr;
00170         multicastMacAddr.setAddressBytes(bytes);
00171         sendPacketToNIC(msg, ie, multicastMacAddr);
00172         return;
00173 #endif
00174     }
00175 
00176     // try look up
00177     ARPCache::iterator it = arpCache.find(nextHopAddr);
00178     //ASSERT(it==arpCache.end() || ie==(*it).second->ie); // verify: if arpCache gets keyed on InterfaceEntry* too, this becomes unnecessary
00179     if (it==arpCache.end())
00180     {
00181         // no cache entry: launch ARP request
00182         ARPCacheEntry *entry = new ARPCacheEntry();
00183         ARPCache::iterator where = arpCache.insert(arpCache.begin(), std::make_pair(nextHopAddr,entry));
00184         entry->myIter = where; // note: "inserting a new element into a map does not invalidate iterators that point to existing elements"
00185         entry->ie = ie;
00186 
00187         EV << "Starting ARP resolution for " << nextHopAddr << "\n";
00188         initiateARPResolution(entry);
00189 
00190         // and queue up packet
00191         entry->pendingPackets.push_back(msg);
00192         pendingQueue.insert(msg);
00193     }
00194     else if ((*it).second->pending)
00195     {
00196         // an ARP request is already pending for this address -- just queue up packet
00197         EV << "ARP resolution for " << nextHopAddr << " is pending, queueing up packet\n";
00198         (*it).second->pendingPackets.push_back(msg);
00199         pendingQueue.insert(msg);
00200     }
00201     else if ((*it).second->lastUpdate+cacheTimeout<simTime())
00202     {
00203         EV << "ARP cache entry for " << nextHopAddr << " expired, starting new ARP resolution\n";
00204 
00205         // cache entry stale, send new ARP request
00206         ARPCacheEntry *entry = (*it).second;
00207         entry->ie = ie; // routing table may have changed
00208         initiateARPResolution(entry);
00209 
00210         // and queue up packet
00211         entry->pendingPackets.push_back(msg);
00212         pendingQueue.insert(msg);
00213     }
00214     else
00215     {
00216         // valid ARP cache entry found, flag msg with MAC address and send it out
00217         EV << "ARP cache hit, MAC address for " << nextHopAddr << " is " << (*it).second->macAddress << ", sending packet down\n";
00218         sendPacketToNIC(msg, ie, (*it).second->macAddress);
00219     }
00220 }
00221 
00222 void ARP::initiateARPResolution(ARPCacheEntry *entry)
00223 {
00224     IPAddress nextHopAddr = entry->myIter->first;
00225     entry->pending = true;
00226     entry->numRetries = 0;
00227     entry->lastUpdate = 0;
00228     sendARPRequest(entry->ie, nextHopAddr);
00229 
00230     // start timer
00231     cMessage *msg = entry->timer = new cMessage("ARP timeout");
00232     msg->setContextPointer(entry);
00233     scheduleAt(simTime()+retryTimeout, msg);
00234 
00235     numResolutions++;
00236 }
00237 
00238 void ARP::sendPacketToNIC(cMessage *msg, InterfaceEntry *ie, const MACAddress& macAddress)
00239 {
00240     // add control info with MAC address
00241     Ieee802Ctrl *controlInfo = new Ieee802Ctrl();
00242     controlInfo->setDest(macAddress);
00243     msg->setControlInfo(controlInfo);
00244 
00245     // send out
00246     send(msg, nicOutBaseGateId + ie->getNetworkLayerGateIndex());
00247 }
00248 
00249 void ARP::sendARPRequest(InterfaceEntry *ie, IPAddress ipAddress)
00250 {
00251     // find our own IP address and MAC address on the given interface
00252     MACAddress myMACAddress = ie->getMacAddress();
00253     IPAddress myIPAddress = ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress();
00254 
00255     // both must be set
00256     ASSERT(!myMACAddress.isUnspecified());
00257     ASSERT(!myIPAddress.isUnspecified());
00258 
00259     // fill out everything in ARP Request packet except dest MAC address
00260     ARPPacket *arp = new ARPPacket("arpREQ");
00261     arp->setByteLength(ARP_HEADER_BYTES);
00262     arp->setOpcode(ARP_REQUEST);
00263     arp->setSrcMACAddress(myMACAddress);
00264     arp->setSrcIPAddress(myIPAddress);
00265     arp->setDestIPAddress(ipAddress);
00266 
00267     static MACAddress broadcastAddress("ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff");
00268     sendPacketToNIC(arp, ie, broadcastAddress);
00269     numRequestsSent++;
00270 }
00271 
00272 void ARP::requestTimedOut(cMessage *selfmsg)
00273 {
00274     ARPCacheEntry *entry = (ARPCacheEntry *)selfmsg->getContextPointer();
00275     entry->numRetries++;
00276     if (entry->numRetries < retryCount)
00277     {
00278         // retry
00279         IPAddress nextHopAddr = entry->myIter->first;
00280         EV << "ARP request for " << nextHopAddr << " timed out, resending\n";
00281         sendARPRequest(entry->ie, nextHopAddr);
00282         scheduleAt(simTime()+retryTimeout, selfmsg);
00283         return;
00284     }
00285 
00286     // max retry count reached: ARP failure.
00287     // throw out entry from cache, delete pending messages
00288     MsgPtrVector& pendingPackets = entry->pendingPackets;
00289     EV << "ARP timeout, max retry count " << retryCount << " for "
00290        << entry->myIter->first << " reached. Dropping " << pendingPackets.size()
00291        << " waiting packets from the queue\n";
00292     while (!pendingPackets.empty())
00293     {
00294         MsgPtrVector::iterator i = pendingPackets.begin();
00295         cMessage *msg = (*i);
00296         pendingPackets.erase(i);
00297         pendingQueue.remove(msg);
00298         delete msg;
00299     }
00300     delete selfmsg;
00301     arpCache.erase(entry->myIter);
00302     delete entry;
00303     numFailedResolutions++;
00304 }
00305 
00306 
00307 bool ARP::addressRecognized(IPAddress destAddr, InterfaceEntry *ie)
00308 {
00309     if (rt->isLocalAddress(destAddr))
00310         return true;
00311 
00312     // respond to Proxy ARP request: if we can route this packet (and the
00313     // output port is different from this one), say yes
00314     if (!doProxyARP)
00315         return false;
00316     InterfaceEntry *rtie = rt->getInterfaceForDestAddr(destAddr);
00317     return rtie!=NULL && rtie!=ie;
00318 }
00319 
00320 void ARP::dumpARPPacket(ARPPacket *arp)
00321 {
00322     EV << (arp->getOpcode()==ARP_REQUEST ? "ARP_REQ" : arp->getOpcode()==ARP_REPLY ? "ARP_REPLY" : "unknown type")
00323        << "  src=" << arp->getSrcIPAddress() << " / " << arp->getSrcMACAddress()
00324        << "  dest=" << arp->getDestIPAddress() << " / " << arp->getDestMACAddress() << "\n";
00325 }
00326 
00327 
00328 void ARP::processARPPacket(ARPPacket *arp)
00329 {
00330     EV << "ARP packet " << arp << " arrived:\n";
00331     dumpARPPacket(arp);
00332 
00333     // extract input port
00334     IPRoutingDecision *controlInfo = check_and_cast<IPRoutingDecision*>(arp->removeControlInfo());
00335     InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterfaceById(controlInfo->getInterfaceId());
00336     delete controlInfo;
00337 
00338     //
00339     // Recipe a'la RFC 826:
00340     //
00341     // ?Do I have the hardware type in ar$hrd?
00342     // Yes: (almost definitely)
00343     //   [optionally check the hardware length ar$hln]
00344     //   ?Do I speak the protocol in ar$pro?
00345     //   Yes:
00346     //     [optionally check the protocol length ar$pln]
00347     //     Merge_flag := false
00348     //     If the pair <protocol type, sender protocol address> is
00349     //         already in my translation table, update the sender
00350     //         hardware address field of the entry with the new
00351     //         information in the packet and set Merge_flag to true.
00352     //     ?Am I the target protocol address?
00353     //     Yes:
00354     //       If Merge_flag is false, add the triplet <protocol type,
00355     //           sender protocol address, sender hardware address> to
00356     //           the translation table.
00357     //       ?Is the opcode ares_op$REQUEST?  (NOW look at the opcode!!)
00358     //       Yes:
00359     //         Swap hardware and protocol fields, putting the local
00360     //             hardware and protocol addresses in the sender fields.
00361     //         Set the ar$op field to ares_op$REPLY
00362     //         Send the packet to the (new) target hardware address on
00363     //             the same hardware on which the request was received.
00364     //
00365 
00366     MACAddress srcMACAddress = arp->getSrcMACAddress();
00367     IPAddress srcIPAddress = arp->getSrcIPAddress();
00368 
00369     if (srcMACAddress.isUnspecified())
00370         error("wrong ARP packet: source MAC address is empty");
00371     if (srcIPAddress.isUnspecified())
00372         error("wrong ARP packet: source IP address is empty");
00373 
00374     bool mergeFlag = false;
00375     // "If ... sender protocol address is already in my translation table"
00376     ARPCache::iterator it = arpCache.find(srcIPAddress);
00377     if (it!=arpCache.end())
00378     {
00379         // "update the sender hardware address field"
00380         ARPCacheEntry *entry = (*it).second;
00381         updateARPCache(entry, srcMACAddress);
00382         mergeFlag = true;
00383     }
00384 
00385     // "?Am I the target protocol address?"
00386     // if Proxy ARP is enabled, we also have to reply if we're a router to the dest IP address
00387     if (addressRecognized(arp->getDestIPAddress(), ie))
00388     {
00389         // "If Merge_flag is false, add the triplet protocol type, sender
00390         // protocol address, sender hardware address to the translation table"
00391         if (!mergeFlag)
00392         {
00393             ARPCacheEntry *entry;
00394             if (it!=arpCache.end())
00395             {
00396                 entry = (*it).second;
00397             }
00398             else
00399             {
00400                 entry = new ARPCacheEntry();
00401                 ARPCache::iterator where = arpCache.insert(arpCache.begin(), std::make_pair(srcIPAddress,entry));
00402                 entry->myIter = where;
00403                 entry->ie = ie;
00404 
00405                 entry->pending = false;
00406                 entry->timer = NULL;
00407                 entry->numRetries = 0;
00408             }
00409             updateARPCache(entry, srcMACAddress);
00410         }
00411 
00412         // "?Is the opcode ares_op$REQUEST?  (NOW look at the opcode!!)"
00413         switch (arp->getOpcode())
00414         {
00415             case ARP_REQUEST:
00416             {
00417                 EV << "Packet was ARP REQUEST, sending REPLY\n";
00418 
00419                 // find our own IP address and MAC address on the given interface
00420                 MACAddress myMACAddress = ie->getMacAddress();
00421                 IPAddress myIPAddress = ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress();
00422 
00423                 // "Swap hardware and protocol fields", etc.
00424                 arp->setName("arpREPLY");
00425                 IPAddress origDestAddress = arp->getDestIPAddress();
00426                 arp->setDestIPAddress(srcIPAddress);
00427                 arp->setDestMACAddress(srcMACAddress);
00428                 arp->setSrcIPAddress(origDestAddress);
00429                 arp->setSrcMACAddress(myMACAddress);
00430                 arp->setOpcode(ARP_REPLY);
00431                 delete arp->removeControlInfo();
00432                 sendPacketToNIC(arp, ie, srcMACAddress);
00433                 numRepliesSent++;
00434                 break;
00435             }
00436             case ARP_REPLY:
00437             {
00438                 EV << "Discarding packet\n";
00439                 delete arp;
00440                 break;
00441             }
00442             case ARP_RARP_REQUEST: error("RARP request received: RARP is not supported");
00443             case ARP_RARP_REPLY: error("RARP reply received: RARP is not supported");
00444             default: error("Unsupported opcode %d in received ARP packet",arp->getOpcode());
00445         }
00446     }
00447     else
00448     {
00449         // address not recognized
00450         EV << "IP address " << arp->getDestIPAddress() << " not recognized, dropping ARP packet\n";
00451         delete arp;
00452     }
00453 }
00454 
00455 void ARP::updateARPCache(ARPCacheEntry *entry, const MACAddress& macAddress)
00456 {
00457     EV << "Updating ARP cache entry: " << entry->myIter->first << " <--> " << macAddress << "\n";
00458 
00459     // update entry
00460     if (entry->pending)
00461     {
00462         entry->pending = false;
00463         delete cancelEvent(entry->timer);
00464         entry->timer = NULL;
00465         entry->numRetries = 0;
00466     }
00467     entry->macAddress = macAddress;
00468     entry->lastUpdate = simTime();
00469 
00470     // process queued packets
00471     MsgPtrVector& pendingPackets = entry->pendingPackets;
00472     while (!pendingPackets.empty())
00473     {
00474         MsgPtrVector::iterator i = pendingPackets.begin();
00475         cMessage *msg = (*i);
00476         pendingPackets.erase(i);
00477         pendingQueue.remove(msg);
00478         EV << "Sending out queued packet " << msg << "\n";
00479         sendPacketToNIC(msg, entry->ie, macAddress);
00480     }
00481 }
